intro: Calotis multicaulis var. breviradiata, commonly known as the narrow-rayed blue bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically hairy and lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions.
